docs.lead_paragraph: The Clinton Administration said today that if Congress took no action, the trust fund that pays Medicare's hospital bills would probably run out of money in the middle of 2001, rather than at the end of 2002 as previously projected. Administration officials said at a hearing of the House Ways and Means Committee that Medicare was spending more than anticipated on hospital care for the elderly, and they confirmed that the Medicare Hospital Insurance Trust Fund spent more than it took in last year, for the first time since 1972.

headline.main: Administration Warns of an Early Shortfall in a Medicare Fund

docs.snippet: The Clinton Administration said today that if Congress took no action, the trust fund that pays Medicare's hospital bills would probably run out of money in the middle of 2001, rather than at the end of 2002 as previously projected.        ...
